@graph.name: Gluten Free Chocolate Cake - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: This is the most amazing gluten free chocolate cake, ever! Decadent, fluffy, moist and easy to make in 1 bowl. No more dry gluten free cakes!

@graph.name: Gluten Free Chocolate Cake
@graph.description: This is the most amazing gluten free chocolate cake, ever! Decadent, fluffy, perfectly sweetened and easy to make in 1 bowl. No more dry or dense gluten free cakes!
recipeIngredient: 2 1/4 cups gluten free flour mix* (I used King Arthur Flour, NO xanthan gum added)
1/2 teaspoon xanthan gum (if using a flour with this added, omit)
1/2 cup neutral flavored oil, such as canola or grapeseed
1 cup boiling hot water (or use hot coffee)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and grease two 8-inch cake pans. I also line them with parchment rounds for easy removal of the cakes later.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and grease two 8-inch cake pans. I also line them with parchment rounds for easy removal of the cakes later.

recipeInstructions.text: Measure 1 cup soy milk in a glass measuring cup and add vinegar. Stir slightly and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Measure 1 cup soy milk in a glass measuring cup and add vinegar. Stir slightly and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the gluten free flour, xanthan gum, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together the gluten free flour, xanthan gum, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda and salt.

recipeInstructions.text: To the bowl with the dry ingredients, add the oil, applesauce, vanilla and milk/vinegar mixture. Mix on medium speed with a hand mixer (or stand mixer with the whisk attachment) until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: To the bowl with the dry ingredients, add the oil, applesauce, vanilla and milk/vinegar mixture. Mix on medium speed with a hand mixer (or stand mixer with the whisk attachment) until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Lower the speed and carefully pour in the boiling water, continuing to mix into the cake batter until combined. The batter will be quite runny at this point.
recipeInstructions.name: Lower the speed and carefully pour in the boiling water, continuing to mix into the cake batter until combined. The batter will be quite runny at this point.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the batter evenly between your cake pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. After 10 minutes of cooling in the pan, carefully remove the cakes from the pans and let cool completely before frosting.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the batter evenly between your cake pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. After 10 minutes of cooling in the pan, carefully remove the cakes from the pans and let cool completely before frosting.

recipeInstructions.text: Only once the cake is completely cooled, frost with chocolate frosting using an icing spatula or just a butter knife and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Only once the cake is completely cooled, frost with chocolate frosting using an icing spatula or just a butter knife and enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: It’s fine to store the cake at room temperature for 1-2 days, or you can refrigerate it for 3-4 days. Make sure to cover any cut parts so it doesn't dry out.
recipeInstructions.name: It’s fine to store the cake at room temperature for 1-2 days, or you can refrigerate it for 3-4 days. Make sure to cover any cut parts so it doesn't dry out.
